metadata.synopsis: Dialog for one of the zombie beggars. After player talks to Father Carrion and has been tasked to kill them, they will react to this and either run to warn their leader, Thrumbo, or confront player. The following states are one-liners and hasmets for each possible quest state (meeting with thrumbo, outside house and inside father carrion's house once fully killed.)
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to Morbus Location: CTY_Main_A Initial position: -105; 19; -104Meeting: 66; 1; -120Outside house: -8; 11; -145Inside house: 1; 8; -157

3.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
3.text: 'Down the stairs, across the sand. Down the stairs, across the sand...'

6.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
6.text: Sister was always good at hiding. But I'll find her this time.

30.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
30.text: Will Thrumbo come and play with me soon?

35.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
35.text: You aren't very nice. But I am. So you can stay.
35.context: NodeContext: A child who's been told to play nicely

48.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
48.text: I will get a bedroom of my own now. I can keep lovely things in it, for when sister can visit.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morbus calls out to his sister (not present - he's actually standing near her grave)NodeContext: Playful, calling out as though playing hide and seek

52.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
52.text: Sister was always good at hiding. But I'll find her this time.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morbus calls out to his sister (not present - he's actually standing near her grave)NodeContext: Playful, calling out as though playing hide and seek

59.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
59.text: Brother Thrumbo said you saved us. You are welcome to play here any time.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morbus calls out to his sister (not present - he's actually standing near her grave)NodeContext: Playful, calling out as though playing hide and seek

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *You recall where you've smelled this beggar's rotten musk before - in Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of the runaways he seeks.*

76.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
76.text: Come out, sister - I will find you!
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morbus calls out to his sister (not present - he's actually standing near her grave)NodeContext: Playful, calling out as though playing hide and seek

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form, the same that tainted Mystic Carrion's chambers. This is one of his runaway servants.*
49.context: NodeContext: Explaining to the player, as if they asked

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another of Mystic Carrion's runaways.*
0.context: NodeContext: Explaining to the player, as if they asked

68.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
68.text: Sister always hides from me. She likes to play.
68.context: NodeContext: Explaining to the player, as if they asked

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Is your sister a zombie, too?
67.context: NodeContext: Not lying to you. He genuinely believes this is part of a game

83.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
83.text: A zombie? Are you playing with me?
83.context: NodeContext: Not lying to you. He genuinely believes this is part of a game

29.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
29.text: When I find sister, I will ask her if you can join our game. She's the oldest.
29.context: NodeContext: 'She's the oldest' as though this explains why it isn't his decision.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Mystic Carrion is looking for you. He sent me.
69.context: NodeContext: Very uncertain - naturally trusting, so this instruction is hard for him to understand

64.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
64.text: No, not him. He isn't allowed to play. Thrumbo said he can't find us.
64.context: NodeContext: Very uncertain - naturally trusting, so this instruction is hard for him to understand

38.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
38.text: Thrumbo said not - not to tell anyone where we went...
38.context: NodeContext: Very uncertain - naturally trusting, so this instruction is hard for him to understand

42.speaker: Player
42.text: We're playing Rivington rules, remember? Which means Thrumbo won, and I have to go congratulate him.
42.context: NodeContext: Absolutely believes you, a bit dissapointed but will be over it by the next line

14.speaker: Player
14.text: It's too late for that. I already caught you. The game's over.
14.context: NodeContext: Absolutely believes you, a bit dissapointed but will be over it by the next line

77.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
77.text: You were playing, too? You must be nice, like Thrumbo.
77.context: NodeContext: Absolutely believes you, a bit dissapointed but will be over it by the next line

12.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
12.text: You were playing, too? You must be nice, like Thrumbo.
12.context: NodeContext: Absolutely believes you, a bit dissapointed but will be over it by the next line

22.text: No, no. You're cheating! I have to hide!

4.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
4.text: No, no. You're cheating! I have to hide!

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Thrumbo's not here to protect you, is he? So tell me. NOW!

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Undead defy the natural order - tell me, or I'll correct the mistake that is your existence.

66.text: I don't know! He explained, but I didn't understand...

78.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
78.text: I don't know! He explained, but I didn't understand...

16.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
16.text: 'Down the stairs, across the sand. Down the stairs, across the sand.'
16.context: NodeContext: Repeating something he's worked very hard to memorise, stressed out by being put under pressure

19.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
19.text: I don't like this game. Leave me alone!
19.context: NodeContext: Scared, panicking - about to run away

32.speaker: Player
32.text: You poor creature. I'll not hurt your friend - I swear on all I hold sacred.
32.context: NodeContext: Utterly trusting of the player, really sweet

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I'll not hurt Thrumbo - I swear it. You can trust me.
63.context: NodeContext: Utterly trusting of the player, really sweet

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Come now - we're friends, aren't we? You can trust me.
15.context: NodeContext: Utterly trusting of the player, really sweet

40.text: I can? That's good, because I like you. You're nice, like Thrumbo.
40.context: NodeContext: Utterly trusting of the player, really sweet

7.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
7.text: I can? That's good, because I like you. You're nice, like Thrumbo.
7.context: NodeContext: Utterly trusting of the player, really sweet

46.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
46.text: He told me what to do, but he said it very quickly. I didn't understand.
46.context: NodeContext: 'Down the stairs, across the sand' with a sing-song rhythm/tune - it's a memory aid, supposed to have helped him escape.

18.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
18.text: All I remember is, 'Down the stairs, across the sand. Down the stairs, across the sand.'
18.context: NodeContext: 'Down the stairs, across the sand' with a sing-song rhythm/tune - it's a memory aid, supposed to have helped him escape.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Very sensible. Don't tell anyone anything.

58.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
58.text: I won't! I'll hide where no one will find me.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I'm playing hide and seek with Thrumbo. Can you help me find him?
79.context: NodeContext: No awareness that this means they are dead. Playful, almost gleeful - thinks he's about to win.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: You're a bit old for hide and seek, aren't you?
44.context: NodeContext: No awareness that this means they are dead. Playful, almost gleeful - thinks he's about to win.

53.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
53.text: Sister is older than me. She always likes to play.
53.context: NodeContext: No awareness that this means they are dead. Playful, almost gleeful - thinks he's about to win.

2.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
2.text: She hides in the ground, but I will find her.
2.context: NodeContext: No awareness that this means they are dead. Playful, almost gleeful - thinks he's about to win.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Do you know where she's hiding?
61.context: NodeContext: Playful, like he knows a secret

43.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
43.context: NodeContext: Playful, like he knows a secret

25.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
25.text: Some people covered her in dirt. But I will find her again.
25.context: NodeContext: Playful, like he knows a secret

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Have you no one else? No other family?
33.context: NodeContext: Aware of his sadness, but not quite able to realise that they aren't coming back.

23.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
23.text: Mother and father hide in the ground with her.
23.context: NodeContext: Aware of his sadness, but not quite able to realise that they aren't coming back.

41.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
41.text: I hope I find them soon. I like this game, but it is less fun to play it alone.
41.context: NodeContext: Aware of his sadness, but not quite able to realise that they aren't coming back.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I'm sorry, but your sister is gone. Best let her rest in peace.

37.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
37.text: I can't leave her out here alone.

85.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
85.text: Sister is always happy to see me - she told me so. She will smile so much when I find her.
85.context: NodeContext: Happy in thoughts of his sister

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Your sister is no more - her soul has left this plane. Do you understand?
54.context: NodeContext: Proud of his sister's skills, not bothered that she lets him win - it makes him love here even more

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Your sister is no more - her soul has left this plane. If you like, we could pray for her?
81.context: NodeContext: Proud of his sister's skills, not bothered that she lets him win - it makes him love here even more

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Your sister is food for the worms, and her soul twists in agony as we speak. She's dead.
55.context: NodeContext: Proud of his sister's skills, not bothered that she lets him win - it makes him love here even more

45.speaker: Player
45.text: If she's in the ground, that means she's dead.
45.context: NodeContext: Proud of his sister's skills, not bothered that she lets him win - it makes him love here even more

5.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
5.text: No... no, she is just good at keeping still.
5.context: NodeContext: Proud of his sister's skills, not bothered that she lets him win - it makes him love here even more

50.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
50.text: She is the best at this game. I never win, except when she lets me.
50.context: NodeContext: Proud of his sister's skills, not bothered that she lets him win - it makes him love here even more

28.speaker: Player
28.text: If I were her, I'd be hiding, too. You smell terrible up close.

20.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
20.text: NO. I am clean. I take good care of myself, like sister taught me.

8.speaker: Strange Beggar Morbus
8.text: Sister might need a wash though. She is hiding from me, in the ground over there.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Look closer. Try to identify the cause of the smell.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Sniff the area, expanding your senses. Try to identify the smell.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: The divine tugs at you. Give in, letting your god flow through you.

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Your divine power focuses on the beggar - revealing the magic that sustains him. This man is a corpse - a zombie.*

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *Your divine power focuses on the beggar - revealing the magic that sustains him. This man is a corpse - a zombie.*

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *Beneath his ragged clothing, you catch a glimpse of rotten flesh - more than any living being could sustain. This man is a zombie.*

39.text: *You try to focus on the beggar, but the smell is too strong, too nauseating. Perhaps the cause is better left unknown.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *You try to focus on the beggar, but the smell is too strong, too nauseating. Perhaps the cause is better left unknown.*

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *That smell again - fetid flesh and bone. This is another zombie.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *An air of decay hangs over the stooped beggar's form. The smell of rot. The smell of death.*
